text: in the USA another 2.4 million people
have filed for unemployment benefits in
the past week more than 38 million
people have now lost their jobs in the
United States since the pandemic hit in
March and these are the worst layoffs
the country has seen since the Great
Depression of the early 1930s our North
America correspondent Nick Bryant is in
New York with the latest 38 million such
a staggering jobless figure that's more
than the population of Canada and it's
not just some abstract statistic
these are livelihoods that are being
destroyed and we're finding the economic
victims of kovat 19 in some unexpected
places we don't normally go in search of
hardship in the treeline communities of
American suburbia but now it's easy to
find
and this the looping queue for a food
bank in New York's commuter belt cars
normally used for school pickup and the
weekly shop now a marker of middle-class
needs some had waited more than five
hours bumper-to-bumper in a queue that
stretched more than a mine for organizer

kovat 19 has dealt yet another body blow

anger this an end the shutdown protests
in Staten Island one of New York's most

members of the middle class not used to

Nik Brandt BBC News New York
